citation.article-title: Herminiimonas aquatilis sp. nov., a new species from drinking water.

p.s: Description of H. aquatilis sp. nov.
H. aquatilis (a.qua.ti′lis, L. masc. adj. aquatilis, living, growing, or found, in or near water, aquatic).
H. aquatilis forms short rod-shaped cells 0.8–1.2 μm in length and 1.0–1.2 μm in width.
Gram stain is negative.
The cells are motile.
Colonies on nutrient agar are yellowish, 2–3 mm in diameter and mucoid.
The optimum growth temperature is about 25 °C, Cytochrome oxidase positive.
Mesophilic.
High amounts of the fatty acids (16:1 ω7c and 16:0) are present. 10:0 3-OH is present.
Ubiquinone Q-8, is the major respiratory quinone.

The polar lipid profile consists of the predominant compounds phosphatidyl ethanolamine, diphosphatidyl glycerol, moderate amounts of phosphatidyl glycerol, and small amounts of three unknown aminophospholipid and one unknown phospholipid.
Major polyamines are 2-hydroxyputrescine and putrescine; moderate amounts of cadaverine and spermidine are present as well.
Traces of diaminopropane, spermine, and homospermidine are also found.
Sugars are not utilized, very few organic acids can serve as single carbon sources.

No acid production could be detected from the following sugars: glucose, lactose, sucrose, d-mannitol, dulcitol, salicin, adonitol, inositol, sorbitol, l-arabinose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, maltose, d-xylose, trehalose, cellobiose, methyl-d-glucoside, erythritol, melibiose, d-arabitol, and d-mannose.
Utilization of pyruvate and dl-lactate was positive.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole sources of carbon: N-acetylgalactosamine, N-acetylglucosamine, l-arabinose, l-arbutine, d-cellobiose, d-fructose, gluconate, d-glucose, d-galactose, d-maltose, d-mannose, α-d-melibiose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sucrose, salicine, d-trehalose, d-xylose, adonitol, i-inositol, d-sorbitol, glycerol, d-mannitol, maltitol, putrescine, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, 4-aminobutyrate, citrate, fumarate, dl-3 hydroxybutyrate, mesaconate, adipate, azelate, glutarate, itaconate, acetate, propionate, suberate, l-aspartate, l-alanine, β-alanine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline, l-serine, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-tryptophane, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, and phenylacetate.
Hydrolysis of l-alanine-p-nitroanilide was positive.

The following compounds were not hydrolyzed: bis-pNP-phosphate, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-galactopyranoside (pNPG), ONPG, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-glucuronide, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-glucopyranoside, pNP-α-d-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-d-xylopyranoside, l-proline-p-nitroanilide, l-glutamate-γ-3-carboxy-pNA 2-deoxythymidine-5′-p-nitrophenyl-phosphate, and p-nitrophenyl-phosphoryl-choline.
Strain CCUG 36956T has been deposited at the Culture Collection of the University Göteborg and in the Culture Collection of the Institut Pasteur, Paris, France as strain CIP 108933T.
The EMBL data base accession number of the partial 16S rRNA gene for strain CCUG 36956T is AM085762.
